turns.speaker: BODINE
turns.text: I'm in the sitting room. Heading for bedroom B-54.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Stay off the floor. Don't stir it up like you did yesterday.

turns.speaker: BODINE
turns.text: I'm tryin' boss.

turns.speaker: BODINE
turns.text: Who's the best? Say it.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: You are, Lewis.  You rolling?

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: BODINE
turns.text: You know, boss, this happened to Geraldo and his career never recovered.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Get that outta my face.

turns.speaker: BODINE
turns.text: She says she's Rose DeWitt Bukater, right? Rose DeWitt Bukater died on the Titanic. At the age of 17. If she'd've lived, she'd be over a hundred now.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: A hundred and one next month.

turns.speaker: BODINE
turns.text: Okay, so she's a very old goddamned liar. I traced her as far back as the 20's... she was working as an actress in L.A. An actress. Her name was Rose Dawson. Then she married a guy named Calvert, moved to Cedar Rapids, had two kids. Now Calvert's dead, and from what I've heard Cedar Rapids is dead.

turns.speaker: BODINE
turns.text: We've put together the world's largest database on the Titanic. Okay, here...

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Rose might not want to see this, Lewis.

turns.speaker: BODINE
turns.text: So let me get this right. You were gonna kill yourself by jumping off the Titanic?  That's great!

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Lewis...

turns.speaker: BODINE
turns.text: Holy shit.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Don't drop it Rose.

turns.speaker: BODINE
turns.text: Rush her.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: It's hers, you schmuck.  Look, Rose, I... I don't know what to say to a woman who tries to jump off the Titanic when it's not sinking, and jumps back onto it when it is... we're not dealing with logic here, I know that... but please... think about this a second.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Hey, Lizzy. I need to talk to you for a second.

turns.speaker: LIZZY
turns.text: Don't you mean work me?

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Look, I'm running out of time. I need your help.

turns.speaker: LIZZY
turns.text: I'm not going to help you browbeat my hundred and one year old grandmother. I came down here to tell you to back off.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Lizzy... you gotta understand something. I've bet it all to find the Heart of the Ocean. I've got all my dough tied up in this thing. My wife even divorced me over this hunt. I need what's locked inside your grandma's memory.  You see this? Right here?

turns.speaker: LIZZY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: That's the shape my hand's gonna be when I hold that thing. You understand? I'm not leaving here without it.

turns.speaker: LIZZY
turns.text: Look, Brock, she's going to do this her way, in her own time. Don't forget, she contacted you. She's out here for her own reasons, God knows what they are.

turns.speaker: BUELL
turns.text: The partners want to know how it's going?

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: How it's going? It's going like a first date in prison, whattaya think?!

turns.speaker: BUELL
turns.text: There's a satellite call for you.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Bobby, we're launching. See these submersibles here, going in the water? Take a message.

turns.speaker: BUELL
turns.text: No, trust me, you want to take this call.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: This is Brock Lovett. What can I do for you, Mrs...?

turns.speaker: BUELL
turns.text: Rose Calvert.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: ...Mrs. Calvert?

turns.speaker: BUELL
turns.text: I told you you wanted to take this call.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Alright. You have my attention, Rose. Can you tell me who the woman in the picture is?

turns.speaker: LOVEJOY
turns.text: None of the stewards have seen her.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: This is ridiculous, Lovejoy. Find her.

turns.speaker: LOVEJOY
turns.text: She's not on the starboard side either.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: We're running out of time. And this strutting martinet...  ...isn't letting any men in at all.

turns.speaker: LOVEJOY
turns.text: The one on the other side is letting men in.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: Then that's our play. But we're still going to need some insurance.  Come on.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: I make my own luck.

turns.speaker: LOVEJOY
turns.text: So do I.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: We're too late.

turns.speaker: LOVEJOY
turns.text: There are still some boats forward. Stay with this one... Murdoch. He seems to be quite... practical.

turns.speaker: LOVEJOY
turns.text: What could possible be funny?

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: I put the diamond in my coat pocket. And I put my coat... on her.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: Your daughter is much too hard to impress, Ruth.  Mind your step.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: So this is the ship they say is unsinkable.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: It is unsinkable. God himself couldn't sink this ship.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: Steerage swine. Apparently missed his annual bath.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Honestly, Cal, if you weren't forever booking everything at the last instant, we could have gone through the terminal instead of running along the dock like some squalid immigrant family.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: All part of my charm, Ruth. At any rate, it was my darling fiancee's beauty rituals which made us late.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: You know I don't like that, Rose.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: She knows.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: It's just the God damned English doing everything by the book.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: There's no need for language, Mr. Hockley.  Go back and turn the heater on in my room, so it won't be too cold when we get back.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You told me to change.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: I couldn't let you wear black on sailing day, sweetpea. It's bad luck.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I felt like black.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: Those mud puddles were certainly a waste of money.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You're wrong. They're fascinating. Like in a dream... there's truth without logic. What's his name again...?  Picasso.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: He'll never amount to a thing, trust me. At least they were cheap.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: What made you think you could put your hands on my fiancee?! Look at me, you filth! What did you think you were doing?!

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Cal, stop! It was an accident.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: An accident?!

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: It was... stupid really. I was leaning over and I slipped.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I was leaning way over, to see the... ah... propellers. And I slipped and I would have gone overboard... and Mr. Dawson here saved me and he almost went over himself.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: You wanted to see the propellers?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Is that the going rate for saving the woman you love?

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: Rose is displeased. Mmm... what to do?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: My God... Cal. Is it a --

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: Diamond. Yes it is. 56 carats.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: It was once worn by Louis the Sixteenth. They call it Le Coeur de la Mer, the --

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: The Heart of the Ocean. Cal, it's... it's overwhelming.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: I had hoped you would come to me last night.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I was tired.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: Yes. Your exertions below decks were no doubt exausting.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I see you had that undertaker of a manservant follow me.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: You will never behave like that again! Do you understand?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I'm not some foreman in your mills than you can command! I am your fiancee --

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Something serious has happened.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: That's right. Two things dear to me have disappeared this evening. Now that one is back...  ...I have a pretty good idea where to find the other.  Search him.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: But I was with him the whole time.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: Maybe he did it while you were putting your clothes back on.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Oh, Mother shut up!  Don't you understand? The water is freezing and there aren't enough boats... not enough by half. Half the people on this ship are going to die.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: Not the better half.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: Where are you going? To him? Is that it? To be a whore to that gutter rat?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I'd rather be his whore than your wife.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Yes, I lived. How awkward for you.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: Rose... your mother and I have been looking for you --

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Is this in any way unclear?

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: What do I tell your mother?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Tell her that her daughter died with the Titanic.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: You're precious to me, Rose.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Jewels are precious. Goodbye, Mr. Hockley.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: I know.  Perhaps you could join us for dinner tomorrow, to regale our group with your heroic tale?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sure. Count me in.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: Good. Settled then.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: This should be amusing.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Can I bum a cigarette?

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: Just a soupcon of lemon...  ...it improves the flavor with champagne.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No caviar for me, thanks.  Never did like it much.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No thanks. I'm heading back.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: Probably best. It'll be all business and politics, that sort of thing. Wouldn't interest you. Good of you to come.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: There are boats on the other side that are allowing men in. Jack and I can get off safely. Both of us.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'll be alright. Hurry up so we can get going... we got our own boat to catch.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: Get in... hurry up, it's almost full.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: You're a good liar.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Almost as good as you.

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: I always win, Jack. One way or another.  Pity I didn't keep that drawing. It's going to be worth a lot more by morning.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Let's see... Fabrizio's got niente. Olaf, you've got squat. Sven, uh oh... two pair... mmm.  Sorry Fabrizio.

turns.speaker: FABRIZIO
turns.text: What sorry? What you got? You lose my money?? Ma va fa'n culo testa di cazzo --

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sorry, you're not gonna see your mama again for a long time...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: 'Cause you're goin' to America!! Full house boys!

turns.speaker: FABRIZIO
turns.text: Porca Madonna!! YEEAAAAA!!!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Goin' home... to the land o' the free and the home of the real hot- dogs! On the TITANIC!! We're ridin' in high style now! We're practically goddamned royalty, ragazzo mio!!

turns.speaker: FABRIZIO
turns.text: You see? Is my destinio!! Like I told you. I go to l'America!! To be a millionaire!!  Capito?? I go to America!!

turns.speaker: FABRIZIO
turns.text: You know somebody?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Of course not. That's not the point.  Goodbye! Goodbye!! I'll miss you!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How you two doin'?

turns.speaker: FABRIZIO
turns.text: I don't know what she's say, she don't know what I say, so we get along fine.

turns.speaker: FABRIZIO
turns.text: The boats are all going.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We gotta get up there or we're gonna be gargling saltwater. Where's Tommy?

turns.speaker: FLEET
turns.text: You can smell ice, you know, when it's near.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Bollocks.

turns.speaker: FLEET
turns.text: Well I can.

turns.speaker: FLEET
turns.text: Cor... look at that, would ya.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: They're a bloody sight warmer than we are.

turns.speaker: FLEET
turns.text: Well if that's what it takes for us two to get warm, I'd rather not, if it's all the same.

turns.speaker: FLEET
turns.text: Oy, mate... that was a close shave.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Smell ice, can you? Bleedin' Christ!

turns.speaker: HITCHINS
turns.text: Keep pulling... away from the ship. Pull.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Ain't you boys ever rowed before? Here, gimme those oars. I'll show ya how it's done.

turns.speaker: HITCHINS
turns.text: The suction will pull us right down if we don't keep going.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: We got room for lots more. I say we go back.

turns.speaker: HITCHINS
turns.text: No! It's our lives now, not theirs. And I'm in charge of this boat! Now row!!

turns.speaker: HITCHINS
turns.text: They'll pull us right down I tell ya!

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Aw knock it off, yer scarin' me. Come on girls, grab your oars. Let's go.  Well come on!

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: I don't understand a one of you. What's the matter with you? It's your men back there! We got plenty a' room for more.

turns.speaker: HITCHINS
turns.text: If you don't shut that hole in yer face, there'll be one less in this boat!

turns.speaker: ISMAY
turns.text: So you've not lit the last four boilers then?

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: No, but we're making excellent time.

turns.speaker: ISMAY
turns.text: Captain, the press knows the size of Titanic, let them marvel at her speed too. We must give them something new to print. And the maiden voyage of Titanic must make headlines!

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: I prefer not to push the engines until they've been properly run in.

turns.speaker: ISMAY
turns.text: Of course I leave it to your good offices to decide what's best, but what a glorious end to your last crossing if we get into New York Tuesday night and surprise them all.  Retire with a bang, eh, E.J.?

turns.speaker: ISMAY
turns.text: Why have we stopped?

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: We've struck ice.

turns.speaker: ISMAY
turns.text: Well, do you think the ship is seriously damaged?

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Take my hand. I'll pull you back in.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: No! Stay where you are. I mean it. I'll let go.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No you won't.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: What do you mean no I won't? Don't presume to tell me what I will and will not do. You don't know me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You would have done it already. Now come on, take my hand.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You're distracting me. Go away.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I can't. I'm involved now. If you let go I have to jump in after you.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Don't be absurd. You'll be killed.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: The fall alone would kill you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It would hurt. I'm not saying it wouldn't. To be honest I'm a lot more concerned about the water being so cold.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: How cold?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Freezing. Maybe a couple degrees over.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ever been to Wisconsin?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well they have some of the coldest winters around, and I grew up there, near Chippewa Falls. Once when I was a kid me and my father were ice- fishing out on Lake Wissota... ice- fishing's where you chop a hole in the --

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I know what ice fishing is!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sorry. Just... you look like kind of an indoor girl. Anyway, I went through some thin ice and I'm tellin' ya, water that cold... like that right down there... it hits you like a thousand knives all over your body. You can't breath, you can't think... least not about anything but the pain.  Which is why I'm not looking forward to jumping in after you. But like I said, I don't see a choice. I guess I'm kinda hoping you'll come back over the rail and get me off the hook here.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You're crazy.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That's what everybody says. But with all due respect, I'm not the one hanging off the back of a ship.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm Jack Dawson.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Pleased to meet you, Mr. Dawson.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: HELP! HELP!!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I've got you. I won't let go.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hello again.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Could I speak to you in private?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Uh, yes. Of course. After you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So, you got a name by the way?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Rose. Rose DeWitt Bukater.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That's quite a moniker. I may hafta get you to write that down.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Mr. Dawson, I --

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Jack.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Jack... I feel like such an idiot. It took me all morning to get up the nerve to face you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, here you are.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Here I am. I... I want to thank you for what you did. Not just for... for pulling me back. But for your discretion.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're welcome. Rose.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Look, I know what you must be thinking! Poor little rich girl. What does she know about misery?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That's not what I was thinking. What I was thinking was... what could have happened to hurt this girl so much she though she had no way out.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I don't... it wasn't just one thing. It was everything. It was them, it was their whole world. And I was trapped in it, like an insect in amber.  I just had to get away... just run and run and run... and then I was at the back rail and there was no more ship... even the Titanic wasn't big enough. Not enough to get away from them. And before I'd really though about it, I was over the rail. I was so furious. I'll show them. They'll be sorry!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Uh huh. They'll be sorry. 'Course you'll be dead.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Oh God, I am such an utter fool.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That penguin last night, is he one of them?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Penguin? Oh, Cal! He is them.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Is he your boyfriend?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Worse I'm afraid.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So you feel like you're stuck on a train you can't get off 'cause you're marryin' this fella.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Yes, exactly!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So don't marry him.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: If only it were that simple.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It is that simple.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Oh, Jack... please don't judge me until you've seen my world.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, I guess I will tonight.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Just some sketches.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: May I?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Jack, these are quite good! Really, they are.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, they didn't think too much of 'em in Paree.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Oh no! Oh, I'm so sorry. Truly!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, they didn't think too much of 'em in Paree.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: And these were drawn from life?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yup. That's one of the great things about Paris. Lots of girls willing take their clothes off.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You liked this woman. You used her several times.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She had beautiful hands.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I think you must have had a love affair with her...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, no! Just with her hands.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You have a gift, Jack. You do. You see people.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I see you.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: And...?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You wouldn'ta jumped.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You know, my dream has always been to just chuck it all and become an artist... living in a garret, poor but free!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You wouldn't last two days. There's no hot water, and hardly ever any caviar.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Listen, buster... I hate caviar! And I'm tired of people dismissing my dreams with a chuckle and a pat on the head.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm sorry. Really... I am.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Well, alright. There's something in me, Jack. I feel it. I don't know what it is, whether I should be an artist, or, I don't know... a dancer. Like Isadora Duncan.... a wild pagan spirit...

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: So then what, Mr. Wandering Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, then logging got to be too much like work, so I went down to Los Angeles to the pier in Santa Monica. That's a swell place, they even have a rollercoaster. I sketched portraits there for ten cents a piece.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: A whole ten cents?!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah; it was great money... I could make a dollar a day, sometimes. But only in summer. When it got cold, I decided to go to Paris and see what the real artists were doing.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Why can't I be like you Jack? Just head out for the horizon whenever I feel like it.  Say we'll go there, sometime... to that pier... even if we only ever just talk about it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Alright, we're going. We'll drink cheap beer and go on the rollercoaster until we throw up and we'll ride horses on the beach... right in the surf... but you have to ride like a cowboy, none of that side-saddle stuff.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You mean one leg on each side? Scandalous! Can you show me?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sure. If you like.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I think I would.  And teach me to spit too. Like a man. Why should only men be able to spit. It's unfair.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: They didn't teach you that in finishing school? Here, it's easy. Watch closely.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I saw that in a nickelodeon once, and I always wanted to do it.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Cal, surely you remember Mr. Dawson.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Jack, must you go?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Time for my coach to turn back into a pumpkin.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: May I cut in, miss?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're still my best girl, Cora.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I don't know the steps.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Just move with me. Don't think.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're not one of them. There's been a mistake.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: A mistake?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Uh huh. You got mailed to the wrong address.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I did, didn't I?  Look! A shooting star.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That was a long one. My father used to say that whenever you saw one, it was a soul going to heaven.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I like that. Aren't we supposed to wish on it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Rose, you're no picnic... you're a spoiled little brat even, but under that you're a strong, pure heart, and you're the most amazingly astounding girl I've ever known and --

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Jack, I --

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No wait. Let me try to get this out. You're amazing... and I know I have nothing to offer you, Rose. I know that. But I'm involved now. You jump, I jump, remember? I can't turn away without knowin' that you're goin' to be alright.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You're making this very hard. I'll be fine. Really.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't think so. They've got you in a glass jar like some butterfly, and you're goin' to die if you don't break out. Maybe not right away, 'cause you're strong. But sooner or later the fire in you is goin' to go out.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: It's not up to you to save me, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're right. Only you can do that.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I have to get back, they'll miss me. Please, Jack, for both our sakes, leave me alone.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Fabrizio said you might be up --

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sssshh. Come here.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Will this light do? Don't artists need good light?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Zat is true, I am not used to working in such 'orreeble conditions.  Hey... Monet!

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Cal insist on lugging this thing everywhere.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Should I be expecting him anytime soon?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Not as long as the cigars and brandy hold out.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What is it? A sapphire?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: A diamond. A very rare diamond, called the Heart of the Ocean.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I believe you are blushing, Mr. Big Artiste. I can't imagine Monsieur Monet blushing.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He does landscapes.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Pretty tough for a valet, this fella.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: He's an ex-Pinkerton. Cal's father hired him to keep Cal out of trouble... to make sure he always got back to the hotel with his wallet and watch, after some crawl through the less reputable parts of town...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Kinda like we're doin' right now -- uh oh!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Where to, Miss?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: To the stars.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Are you nervous?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Au contraire, mon cher.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You're trembling.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's okay. I'm alright.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: When this ship docks, I'm getting off with you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This is crazy.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I know. It doesn't make any sense. That's why I trust it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Looks okay. I don't see anything.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Could it have damaged the ship?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It didn't seem like much of a bump. I'm sure we're okay.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's bad.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: We have to tell Mother and Cal.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Now it's worse.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Come with me, Jack. I jump, you jump... Right?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This is horseshit.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Cal, you can't be serious! We're in the middle of an emergency and you --

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't you believe it, Rose. Don't!

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: He couldn't have.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That guy Lovejoy put it in my pocket.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I know, I know.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: See if you can find a key for these. Try those drawers. It's a little brass one.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So... how did you find out I didn't do it?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I didn't.  I just realized I already knew.
